translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Kuṭaja Flower Birth Stories

analyzed: tivaṇṭi pupphiya tthera a padāna  abhibhūtam panijjhanti

translated: “They all came together and criticized me,🔽‘He is overcome by desire.’
fever arose.🔽At that time, a disciple of the Buddha,

original: Ye me baddhacarā āsuṁ,🔽te me pupphaṁ aduṁ tadā;
analyzed: ye me baddha carāḥ āsu  te me puppham adum tadā
translated: Those who were my bound followers🔽then offered me a flower.
and placed it on the disciple.
I did not go to the lower realms.
I was a powerful wheel-turning monarch.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tivaṇṭipupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā tivaṇṭipupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: … the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus have I heard. On that occasion the venerable Tivaṇṭipupphiya recited these verses.
The Elder Tivaṇṭipupphiya’s Birth Story is the tenth.
The twenty-ninth sub-chapter on the kuṭaja flower is finished.
